title: SEBASTIAN SHAKESPEARE: TV wildlife presenter Chris Packham is heartbroken over death of his pooch
text:
When TV star Chris Packham’s beloved miniature poodle Itchy died in 2016, he was so bereft that he kept the dog’s body in the freezer to help cope with his loss.

Now, the Autumnwatch presenter has revealed he’s been nursing a secret heartache: Itchy’s brother, Scratchy, has also passed away.

‘He was the light and epicentre of my universe,’ Packham tells me.

Scratchy died two weeks short of his 16th birthday. But Packham’s zookeeper girlfriend, Charlotte Corney, and stepdaughter, Megan McCubbin, have since acquired miniature poodle puppies named Sid and Nancy.

Chris Packham has revealed he's been nursing a secret heartache. His miniature poodle Scratchy has sadly passed away. 'He was the light and epicentre of my universe,' Packham says

‘They’ve got big paws to fill,’ says Packham. ‘They are relatives of Itchy and Stratchy. I’m bonding with them, but I don’t know if they have helped me. It’s too early to ask that question.’

In his 2016 memoir, Fingers In The Sparkle Jar, Packham, 58, who has Asperger’s syndrome, revealed that he has endured depression throughout his life and experienced suicidal thoughts after losing an earlier pet, a one-year-old dog called Fish.

He said it was only his beloved Itchy and Scratchy who saved him from taking his own life: ‘They loved me, so I couldn’t do it,’ he wrote in the book. ‘They kept me alive . . . I owe them my life. I always will.’

Packham frequently described Itchy and Scratchy as the loves of his life. ‘We always had a very close bond, the three of us,’ he said. ‘We were like peas in a pod.

‘It was a mutual love affair, very much so. We always shared our space and our food and our time.’

The naturalist also revealed he wants his ashes to be mixed with those of his beloved pets.

He explained: ‘Our ashes are going to get all mixed together and thrown out in the woods in a favourite spot in the New Forest so that we can be something together.’

Lottie Moss gets it off her chest...

Waifish Kate Moss once admitted she considered having a boob job because she hated being so ‘flat- chested’ — but decided against it, declaring: ‘Can you imagine?’

Lottie Moss, 21, confirms she has had surgical breast implants

However, her model half-sister, Lottie, has taken a different direction and confirms that she has had surgical implants.

‘I did my boobs and I’m very happy with that,’ says the 21-year-old Calvin Klein mannequin.

‘You’ve got to spend money on yourself and you’ve got to treat yourself, and this is one of those little treats that women like to do.’

Lottie reveals she has also had lip fillers. ‘I told my family about my boobs, but I didn’t about my lips.

‘With boobs, my mum [Inger] always knew that I felt uncomfortable and so it was very easy to say that I was going to get them done.

'She was like: “For sure, I wish I’d got mine done.”

‘My lips were actually something that I slightly regret.

'I did it because I was following the crowd. I didn’t need it.’

Celebrity photographer Rankin, who snapped the Queen at Buckingham Palace for her Golden Jubilee in 2002, says she remains his favourite subject to shoot.

‘The Queen was good, she was very, very funny, takes the p*** out of you mercilessly and has a good sense of humour,’ he tells me.

‘She’s brilliant to photograph, but I only got four minutes with her, so I don’t know her that well.’

Playing with Keeler? Not for me, says Suchet

Hercule Poirot actor David Suchet expresses regret that he turned down the role of politician John Profumo in the 1989 movie Scandal.

‘It was the first major film role I was offered,’ he says of the part played by Sir Ian McKellen. ‘I had a conscience.

‘I thought: “John is still alive. I would be depicting him doing all these things with [19-year-old model] Christine Keeler. This isn’t right.”

So I turned it down. In the end, I said no, and they were very, very upset with me. They were very angry.

‘A friend of mine later said: “Why didn’t you get in touch with [John]? He might have said: ‘I don’t care.’ ”

‘I did not get started for a long time — and I often wonder if it was because of that.’

Pyschotherapist Annabel Giles, former wife of Ultravox singer Midge Ure, was unimpressed by a minute’s silence for mental health on ITV’s Britain’s Got Talent.

‘So, BGT thinks we’re all watching in silence, rather than slagging off or praising the acts? Or even that we’re not watching alone?

‘Nice idea, good intention, but loneliness abounds and one minute of silence isn’t going to do it. Some people have the TV on to drown the roar of loneliness.’

Will’s costume is all at sea

Hello sailor! Pop star Will Young pushed the boat out at his weekend concert in Southend by dressing up as an ocean liner as he performed two songs, Who Am I and Joy.

Neither song has obvious nautical references nor did he explain his choice of outfit.

Will’s wardrobe has previously been all at sea and he has talked about his passion for dresses and skirts.

He said: ‘Men can occupy a dress and skirt and actually end up looking more masculine. I promise.’

Will Young pushed the boat out at his weekend concert in Southend by dressing up as an ocean liner as he performed two songs, Who Am I and Joy

She’s Hollywood royalty, but Oscar-winning actress Catherine Zeta-Jones has an alien sense of humour — as far as husband Michael Douglas and their two children are concerned.

‘There’s a lot of British comedy where I’m literally rolling on the floor and the family wonder what I’m laughing at,’ reflects Zeta-Jones, 50.

But she may have an ally in father-in-law, Kirk Douglas, now 102, who, she says, professes bewilderment that Michael picked up a Golden Globe for his role in Romancing The Stone. ‘He says [to Michael]: “You’re not funny. Make me laugh!”’

Sol will be missing his alfresco pizza

Pizzeria to Chelsea society, La Delizia — where Freddie Windsor wooed his wife Sophie Winkleman — is facing a crisis after being ordered by the local council to remove its outside tables.

‘It’s a tiny restaurant,’ owner Michele Damiano tells me.

‘Inside, I’ve got 15 tables and outside four. This will slash my income,’ adds Damiano, who has had tables on the pavement for the past 33 years.

One regular has ruled the council offside — England football legend Sol Campbell. ‘It’s a place for people from all walks of life — from locals to royalty,’ Sol assures me. ‘The council should reconsider.’

Madden’s kept hanging about

Bodyguard star Richard Madden became the nation’s heartthrob when he showed off his athletic physique playing brawny protection officer David Budd in the BBC thriller.

Now the actor, who is tipped to be the next James Bond, seems to be learning to fly. The 33-year-old Scot has been pictured in a denim jacket and jeans in Virginia Water, Surrey, while being suspended above the lake.

Bodyguard star Richard Madden seems to be learning to fly. The 33-year-old Scot has been pictured in a denim jacket and jeans above the lake at Virginia Water, Surrey

He is filming a new campaign for Calvin Klein, for which he has been enlisted as the face of its men’s fragrances. ‘It’s a sexy shoot which will definitely keep Richard’s female fans happy,’ said a source close to the set.

The advert will echo the moment Colin Firth emerged dripping wet from the water as Mr Darcy in the BBC’s adaptation of Pride And Prejudice in 1995.

authors: Sebastian Shakespeare For The Daily Mail
